archetype_name: Family Light & Fresh: Japanese and Vietnamese Weeknights
name: Ginger-Lime Chicken Lettuce Cups with Jasmine Rice (No Soy, No Sesame)
description: Light, herb-forward chicken served in crisp romaine leaves with a citrusy dressing and a side of steamed jasmine rice. Mild, simple, and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 1/2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear.
Trim 1 lb chicken thighs and slice into thin bite-size strips.
Rinse and dry 1 head romaine lettuce; separate large leaves.
In a small bowl, mix dressing: lime juice and zest, 1 1/2 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tsp honey, a pinch of salt, and a pinch of black pepper.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add rinsed jasmine rice and 2 cups water to a pot. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 12–15 minutes until tender. Rest covered 5 minutes, then fluff.
Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high. Add 1 tbsp canola oil.
Season chicken with 1/2 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp black pepper. Add to skillet and cook 5–6 minutes, stirring, until just cooked through.
Add minced garlic to the chicken. Cook 30–60 seconds until fragrant. Turn off heat.
Toss sliced cucumber, carrots, and half the spring onion with half the dressing and half the chopped mint.
Drizzle remaining dressing over the cooked chicken and toss. Sprinkle with remaining mint and spring onion.
Assemble: Fill romaine leaves with a spoonful of rice, top with chicken and the dressed vegetables. Serve extra rice on the side.
